intro: Haplophyllum halepense, commonly known as the Aleppo spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features upright, branching stems that are covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the spring. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, with a distinctive blue-green color. Haplophyllum halepense is adapted to dry, rocky environments and is often found in disturbed soils.
